itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Brinley "Bryn" Williams (3 April 1895 – 5 January 1987) was a Welsh dual-code international rugby wing who played rugby union for Llanelli and rugby league with Batley. At rugby union he won three caps for Wales, and at rugby league he won two caps for Wales, and one cap for Other Nationalities.

response: * Brinley Williams won caps for Wales while at Batley in 1921 against England and Australia, and won a cap for Other Nationalities while at Batley in 1921 against England
*5 January - Brinley Williams, Wales dual-code rugby international, 91
*3 April – Brinley Williams, Wales dual-code rugby international (died 1987)
